intro: Ulex europaeus subsp. gallii, commonly known as the common goat's-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its spiny, upright stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
